title: River Taw Teign Link Walking Route

images.title: Sticklepath Bridge on the river Taw as seen from downstream by Roger A Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sticklepath Bridge on the river Taw as seen from downstream

images.title: Richard Dorrell / Market cross, South Zeal
images.caption: Market cross, South Zeal

images.title: Derek Harper / Towards South Tawton from Ramsley Hill
images.caption: Towards South Tawton from Ramsley Hill. A path descends from the top of Ramsley Hill between high bracken and bramble. The elements in the middle distance are in SX6594, including the tower of South Tawton church.

images.title: Blackaton Wood by Sarah Charlesworth, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Blackaton Wood

images.title: Chagford: by the Teign by Martin Bodman, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Chagford, by the Teign

description: This short walk takes you through the beautiful Dartmoor National Park and links the Tarka Trail and Two Moors Way . The walk begins near the River Taw in Sticklepath and heads through South Zeal before climbing Ramsley Hill where you can enjoy fabulous views of Dartmoor. You then head through Throwleigh and Blackaton Wood Nature Reserve before coming to the finish point at Chagford .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Oxenham Arms is a good choice for a pit stop in the village of South Zeal. The pub has an interesting history having originally been a 12th-century monastery. It has a charming interior with low beams, flagstone floors and open fires. Outside there's a nice garden area for warmer weather. You can find them at postcode EX202JT for your sat navs. The pub also has a car park and is dog friendly.

display_address: Sticklepath, West Devon, Devon, England, EX20 2NR, United Kingdom
